meanings.definition: To awaken or stir up again.
meanings.sent1: After the long nap, the loud noise helped rearouse the sleepy cat.
meanings.sent2: The smell of fresh coffee in the morning can rearouse your energy for the day.
meanings.sent3: Trying to rearouse the old computer by hitting it won't work, but maybe a restart will.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected compliment from a stranger can rearouse feelings of confidence and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the alarm clock was not enough to rearouse the deep sleeper from his dream.

meanings.sent1: The old friends met for coffee to rearouse their past memories and laughter.
meanings.sent2: A walk in the park can rearouse your love for nature and fresh air.
meanings.sent3: The smell of freshly baked cookies can rearouse anyone's appetite, even after a big meal.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected gift from a loved one can rearouse feelings of warmth and gratitude.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the sunset over the ocean never fails to rearouse a sense of wonder and awe.
